title: Effective efficient service
body: GP contacted me straight away and dealt with my concerns professionally and efficiently. Amazing service

title: Excellent
body: Tick bite - referred here by my G.P - I cannot praise the staff highly enough for the treatment I received.

title: Brilliant service
body:
Fell of my bike and injured my middle finger, phoned 111 and spoke to a paramedic who did an assessment on the phone via a FaceTime call. It was very quick and efficient. It saved me going to my nearby urgent treatment centre. And this service email saved the NHS money.
I have to I was rather sceptical when I dialled the number. But it was a very professional and efficient service.

title: Caring GP practice
body: The staff at the surgery are very attentive and also caring. Appointments available to meet need and feel safe and looked after when I visit

title: Very helpful
body: I attended surgery to see the doctor and nurse. I was pleased with service especially in the current climate.

title: Great staff
body: I had a new non-covid health problem and have had to have several appointments in the past few months. Every day I called up I was able to have a video call the same day - more convenient and safe for both of us. I have been treated with cheery hellos from receptionists and GPs. I have been very impressed at how well the surgery has adapted so quickly and smoothly to these new times. Thank you!

title: Russel hall restaurant
body:
It was good today that on entering the hospital
We were given masks to wear and hand sanitizer by a very polite gentleman.  But, I sat in the restaurant for over an hour and none of the staff came out to wipe over the tables, most of which had bits of food, cups, newspapers ect left on the tables.  Yes, customers should and could easily have moved their own and put it into the bins, some did and some didn’t.  But surely the tables should be wiped over and sprayed after each customer.   Food was also on the chairs.  This is not good enough, especially in an hospital.  At one point 3 ladies were chatting behind the counter in the coffee section.  It would only have taken them a few minutes to clean the tables.
Very disappointed.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic practice
body: Had a operation on my spine, before I had the operation the information and care was fantastic. Once I got to the practice nothing was too much trouble. Every member of staff were just fantastic and caring. The difference they have made already to my life is incredible and I carnt thank them enough. Would recommend to anybody. Thank you all

title: Fantastic service
body: Compared to my last surgery, I am very happy with the service. I am accommodated very well by all the staff. My concerns are addressed in a professional manner. Many thanks.

author: Jesre49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: "Very happy"
body: I am very happy with the service. I feel I am not important or no one special but I have been treated as though I am. Thank you Jessica

author: Jesre49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Thank you District Nurses
body:
To the Stapleford District Nurses who attended to my wife.  
I would like to send my great and sincerest thanks to all of you who attended my wife in the last few days of her life.  
You were caring and compassionate and always accessible despite COVID and I am sure, made her last days comfortable and bearable.  
Love to you all. XX

author: circinussx48
title: Overwhelmed by the care we received
body:
My husband woke with a severe headache at 4am. We tried paracetamol, but with no relief. He then was sick a couple of times. Over the morning we were unsure what this was but when he told me his vision was blurred I called 111. Their advice was to go to A &E within the hour, which shocked us. However, we took their advice and went just after 12 noon. Despite a busy A & E we were seen promptly by the Triage Nurse and my husband referred for a brain scan within 20mins. By this time we were getting worried as his sight was reducing in one eye and he couldn't see the clock face numbers anymore.  
As soon as the scan result excluded a brain abnormality he was sent to the Eye Department. Even though it was a Sunday afternoon we were met by such professionalism and kindness by this team of 2 - a Registered Nurse and Ophthalmology Consultant (SB and Miss T)- that we were almost overwhelmed by their care.  
Almost immediately an iv injection was given to reduce the pressure in the affected eye and then drops. Both staff were at the end of a long day shift at the weekend but gave us the impression our care was important to them. By the time we left my husbands eyesight was restored and the follow up treatment was organised and carried out the next day by laser. We feel we had the best treatment we could have got anywhere in the uk, from 111, A &E and Ophthalmology. Thank you all!  
[Unhappy with 'Appointments']  
[Unhappy with 'Reception']  
[Unhappy with 'Cleanliness']  
[Unhappy with 'Staff attitude']  
[Unhappy with 'Staff skills']  
[Unhappy with 'Team work']  
[Unhappy with 'Medication']  
[Unhappy with 'Introductions']  
[Unhappy with 'Explanations']  
[Unhappy with 'Involved in decisions']  
[Unhappy with 'Nurses']  
[Unhappy with 'Doctor']  
[Unhappy with 'Other staff']

readBy.name: East Of England Ambulance Service NHS Trust

author: Grandad1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My cannabis use
body: I have tried to reduce cannabis myself but always got angry so increased it again.   I came to cgl and my keyworker Carol talked me through a slow reduction, she helps me, talks me through reducing so I feel good about it and she cares.   This has helped me and I am still reducing without getting angry.

author: mellowosnd
title: Stroke
body:
With covid 19 not seen anyone would have been different a lot carried over the phone and link video.  
Staff have done the best they could, would have done more for us think they would have under circumstances, done a good job.  
Done as much as they could have done under the circumstance , I appreciate it.

author: ORH
title: Grateful for my daughters day surgery
body:
My daughter had a nasty fall which resulted in a broken wrist. I brought her to A &E at Wishaw where she was xrayed and told she may need surgery ( she is 17 so i couldn't be with her due to covid 19). Phoned the next day and asked to present at day surgery the following morning.  
She had surgery to her wrist and was discharged later that day.  
I am so grateful to all the staff involved in my daughters care and can't thank them enough. Throughout every staff member was so helpful and we were well looked after.  
Thank you

author: Zack
title: My hand injury sustained on an industrial table saw
body:
Wearing gloves and got too close to the operating saw blade.  
The glove snagged on the blade and dragged my fingers across the blade.  
Went to Falmouth A&E but injury was too much for that dept.  
Told to go to Royal Cornwall Hospital for necessary treatment.  
Arrived at Treliske and was seen shortly afterwards by the first doctor.  
Within another couple of hours I was in the system awaiting a visit to the theatre.  
By late that evening I had had my initial clean up of the wound and was sent home to return for remedial surgery the next day.  
Arrived and was admitted to theatre once more where the hand surgery team performed their amazing works and saved and repaired my damaged finger.  
Following surgery I was under the supervision of the hand therapy unit for the following twelve to fourteen weeks.  
I would just like to say the utter care, professionalism, skill and attitude afforded me by every single member of staff during the course of my whole period of treatment were of the absolute highest quality, and had this been a privately funded hospital, I do not believe for one minute I could have received a better level of help, care, and absolute commitment than I received at this outstanding hospital.  
A very heartfelt thank you to all concerned, and may you all continue your absolutely vital, amazing and dedicated works for many years to come.  
Thank you sincerely

author: Roysterboyster
title: Helpful advice & reassurance
body:
lump removed, felt nervous going in to the operation.  
In mid June, I had a minor operation and was overwhelmed by the professionalism, of your staff. Making me feel completely at ease. With their excellent bedside manner. There helpful advice and reassurance, after the operation also put me at ease. If I ever need another operation in the future hopefully it will be David and Kirsty, that perform the operation.

author: Cenzo
title: Isolation and lockdown.
body: It's been beneficial to me as I only have to pick my medication up every 2 weeks consequently there are less truggers and less contact with likeminded individuals. The worry of picking up is also dispelled. I'm lucky as my contact at chi.. John is brilliant and throughout lockdown has been right there for me.

author: Sheba64
title: My 3 monthly vb12 injection
body:
I called my surgery yesterday to book my routine appt for 3 monthly vb12 injection with the nurse. The young lady that answered the call suggested the process had changed and she would arrange for a doctor to call me back.  
I still hadn’t received a call in the afternoon and called back. The lady that answered the call this time seemed a bit more knowledgeable and suggested they were following government guidelines. She did suggest that either a doctor or a nurse would call me back to have a discussion around this and I did stress how tired and worried I was about this.  
I received no call yesterday and have been on the internet searching guidelines around this. I will wait until this afternoon to see if I get a call then will call back again. I am really worried that they are going to suggest I will need to wait for my jab and was wondering if anyone else had an issue like this  
_**Update at 11:31 on 25/6/20:**_  
I just wanted to advise everyone that I have now had my vb12 injection and bloods taken to check my intrinsic factor. GP’s in Scotland will be doing a review as if your intrinsic factor is above a certain level then there may be other options such as taking a daily tablet. I feel much better now after discussing this with my Doctor and Nurse 👍👍

author: Mick r
title: Excellent inpatient stay
body: I was taken in quite quickly to Clayton ward at the end of June and the staff were amazing and friendly and very caring, staff nurse Alice was so thorough in her work and all the staff from the cleaners and the dinner staff were excellent

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

author: DEH
title: My experience of the Let’s Talk service
body:
l was experiencing difficulties with my mental health, this came to peak during February and was a build up of events and a heavy work load, prior to lockdown.  
I visited my GP and decided to take his advice to use Lets Talk.  
I phoned the service and was immediately contacted for a telephone assessment. During the initial call I was told how the service could help and support me with clear instruction on timing due to lockdown.  
After my telephone assessment I was contacted by Steven my Therapist. I was reluctant to talk with a stranger let alone a man, but l couldn’t have been in better hands. During our sessions, Steven was sympathetic, kind and extremely understanding, which was absolutely vital to my mental recovery.  
I used the service for 3 months, and although it was brief, this was everything l needed to get me back to being me again.  
I am so grateful to my GP and Steven and l would highly recommend the service to anyone.

author: Chribanna
title: So impressed with staff
body: I was really nervous about having a colposcopy following an abnormal smear test. I wasn’t concerned about the outcome, but knew the procedure itself would make me panic. I explained beforehand that I was likely to panic and get upset, but for them to continue as I worked through it. I had 3 professional women in the room and they were fantastic. The health professional actually doing the procedure listened to my wishes and continued even as I got upset, though still checked in with me reminding me I was in control. The other 2 ensured they kept talking to me, reassuring me but also asking unrelated questions to keep me distracted. I can’t thank them enough for listening to me but also showing compassion and reassurance. So impressed!

author: Apricot
title: A member of the Administration Team
body:
I called The Walton Centre recently enquiring about an urgent request from my GP for a 'review' regarding my medication. Like many of us we have been left without pain relief during this pandemic and life has been intolerable. No communication regarding when clinics will resume, no communication from the consultant. My GP requested input from my Consultant.  
Days later nothing had arrived for my GP, I called and spoke a Secretary. I received a very rude and very inappropriate attitude. Their response seemed aggressive and extremely short tempered. Problems with the same secretary in the past but even though I have mentioned this to others nothing appears to have changed regarding their attitude and the way they speak to me as a patient. I had my phone on speaker phone as I am unable to hold the phone with my daughter so that we could trace what was actually happening to the doctor's recommendations expected days ago. I was told it went in the post! ! it wasn't faxed or emailed. Total lack of understanding.  
This should have been emailed or faxed so that my GP received it asap....not days later with the post especially being slower then normal during this crisis we are all enduring. This member of staff acted rude, aggressive, totally flippant and their attitude was totally appalling. Fortunately for me this time I had a witness to the conversation. It has been normal to always blame me when I have tried to make a complaint because of my mental health problems as well as neurological problems. During the last few months I have been left to just get on with it like most of us, in pain, not functioning and life is grime. This recent attitude towards me and my GP has caused upset, alarm and a complete lack of respect to the NHS profession as well as to me personally. Disgraceful behaviour.

author: Theunloved1
title: Being discharged without support again
body: I've been under the CMHT Putney and roehampton but they have continued to lack in support and help. No one really listens to me or even wants to help me properly. I'm now being discharged without support again and I'm so disappointed with the lack of help and understanding. One of the things that really upsets me was being told how I sound better on the phone, how that's been worked out when I've cried every time in the phone sessions is beyond me. I don't even believe that if I completely break down that I will ever have help from them.

readBy.name: South West London and St George's Mental Health NHS Trust

author: GalaxyS9
title: Recovery support
body:
I had my first meeting today with various existing members it was very helpful and I definitely took things away I hadn't thought about in certain ways before.  
Other peoples story's and coping methods can be insightful.  
All though my issues didn't seem as severe as others, there were definitely similarities in the struggle and coping with them.  
The meeting host was called Inertiia she was very welcoming and made me feel at ease within the first few minutes as I felt like it was the first day at school and scary to put my hand up.  
Inertiia was very insightful and explained things in a very understandable way without being patronising.  
10/10 experience.  
Good to know they are around for support,easy to see how it helps people and makes a difference.

author: Tina A
title: Volunteers spreading positivity and light during hard times
body: My mother is in Glasgow royal at present and I have only been able to drop in things that are very important to her. There are volunteers at the door who can’t do enough to help you and I want to thank them for taking things to my mum and always spreading positivity and light during a very hard time. Thank you for all you do.

author: Holidays 2020
title: Wonderful, Caring and professional team
body:
The Urology team were wonderful, caring and professional.  
As a NHS member of staff , and already under the care of Mr Harding and his team , I was admitted to ward as a patient a few weeks ago following issues with my bladder function/SNS /pain and infection.  
The staff from medical admission suite to ward 3 were very professional and sympathetic during my admission and stay on the ward ( given me my own room and 100% care and attention)  
I was treated with respect and dignity at all times , the staff on the ward day and night where comforting and informative in getting me the best care when in pain and feeling unwell .  
I am full of admiration for all the staff who where involved in looking after me during my time in hospital ( especially Joanne my Specialist nurse ) and everyone including porters, domestic team , house keepers, nurses and doctors who where friendly, skilled and hardworking.  
I also noticed and extremely impressed in all areas of the department by the calm manner in which staff carried out their duties , especially with the covid19 pandemic and having to wear PPE.  
I am deeply grateful for the wonderful care that I had at all times in the Freeman Hospital , well done.  
Many thanks.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: echoxp34
title: Tinnitus appointments
body:
I was really struggling to manage my tinnitus and it was keeping me awake at night. After undergoing some tests at my GPS and local hospital I was referred to a Senior Hearing Therapist at the Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust.  
My initial appointment was comprehensive and it was clear from the outset that Liz my therapist was an extremely skilled practitioner who considered my tinnitus in a holistic manner, considering my wider well being in addition to hearing-related issues.  
I left the appointment with a great deal of homework! Some very useful reading material; instructions to use a special app each night for a prolonged period of time and suggestions to incorporate additional mindfulness and stress-reducing activity into my life.  
Shortly before my follow up appointment lockdown began however I followed the advice and was very pleasantly surprised to be offered a remote follow-up in mid June, something I had assumed would not be happening due to the Covid-19 situation.  
This follow-up appointment enabled me to reflect on the progress I had made with my tinnitus and I realised that by following the advice given by Liz my tinnitus has massively reduced over the last few months and I have now virtually no negative impact on my life as a result of the condition.  
Liz once again used a very holistic approach and I felt valued and supported as a patient. I am incredibly grateful for her support and considerable expertise and feel very lucky to have been provided with access to such a high quality service. Reflection has enabled me to realise that I have developed the tools to manage this condition moving forward and has enhanced wider work I had already begun regarding stress management and maintaining positive mental health.  
Thank you for all of your help and support Liz!

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

author: Mentalhealthsupporter
title: Receptionist made my daughter feel even worse
body:
Receptionist were so rude to us! I think they need a lesson in mental health ! Made my daughter feel even worse when it takes bravery to ring in the first place !  
I feel disgusted

author: FD30SNOTLW036
title: Lucy Wade Unit
body:
Right where do I start?  
I have sat here on this brown sofa asking staff and patients that are awake, and asking them what they think is good and what could do with a change here are their responses:  
Good-  
Good community atmosphere.  
Supportive staff- goes beyond job role- even out of hours.  
Persuade patients to follow a healthier life style.  
Positive communication- between staff and patients.  
Facilities- drinking dispenser.  
Good space- when loud can go on your own (if allowed.)  
Inviting space.  
Support and mutual respect between patients.  
Conservatory and sensory room, available- most places don’t have this.  
Change-  
Needs to be dimmer lights in communal areas, as it’s very light even at night.  
Painting on walls- different colours,  
Layout should be more open.  
Doors slam- very loud.  
More one to one time with named nurse- not currently happening.  
Ear plugs should be available at all times.  
Freedom- fresh air- garden time- our door activities (everyday if ok?)  
Shouting. Unnecessary/ inappropriate comments.  
Floors are dirty- when you can’t wear shoes the dirt shows a lot!  
**Staff have to pay for food! Dude! This isn’t fair!! This is one I think someone needs to do something about! It’s not fair on the staff! The canteen staff make so much of it surely the staff can have some? For free?  
Overflow meals need to be given to the home less. Or staff!

author: curlytop
title: Hearing aid repair/maintenance
body: I phoned yesterday The clinic is shut and will be for the foreseeable future 'We can't have people coming into the hospital ' You are required to send your hearing aids in the post so are without them for several days !! Why don't they have a van like breast screening ?? As if things are not difficult enough for deaf people at the moment with screens and masks and social distancing. It is just miserable and quite disappointing in this day and age .

title: Recent visit to a&e
body: Due to Covid controls desk in corridor with screen. Nurse sat behind screen low down so had to speak loudly. Persons stood behind me could hear all my details. Felt awkward as was already there for chest pains not good

author: Elmoelmo
title: Lack of support
body:
Since March 2018 my son has been passed around different services with no one taking responsibility for his wellbeing. In March 2018 my son was referred to a community Peads doctor and referred again in August. I spoke to a senior staff member in community peads department and they advised that they would write to my sons GP to offer another line of enquiry that my son should try for his sleep problem.  
My son is 10 years old with multiple conditions. I was referred to CAMHS who put my son on a waiting list. Once he was at the front of the waiting list they rejected his referral and passed him on to the sleep clinic in Oct 2018. The sleep clinic put him on a waiting list and again once he was at the front of list he was rejected and referred back to CAMHS Nov 2018. Again, he was put on a waiting list and then once at the top rejected and referred to the community peads Feb 2019.  
Community peads again after the waiting list rejected his referral and put him back to CAMHS Sept 19 who again has put him on a waiting list for 6 months. CAMHS had tried to include the community peads again on Dec 2019 and rejected again. We are now in 2020 and even though I was advised that my son would get an appointment from CAMHS this time I have still not received any word.  
I asked My GP to write two complaints about how no one is even taking the time to speak to my son before rejecting his referral. My son has contamination fears, anxiety and sleeping difficulties that impacts on his emotional wellbeing and learning. Where are my sons basic humans rights here? As he is not being listened too or valued. I would like a reply please.

author: Plutonium
title: Fall and broken ribs
body: I fell down stairs at home lay unconscious until next morning, ambulance crew fantastic and put me at ease. have mechanical aorta valve so lucky I didn't bleed out. 7 broken ribs 5 double so 12 breaks lung didn't look good at time nor did kidney.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

author: Sue84
title: Thanking the wonderful staff that looked after my little girl
body:
Last week my 14 month old fell and hit her head off my bedside table. It was bleeding and needed Attention. I took her to the minor injuries unit where she was assessed by the very lovely ANP Carol, she gave her a thorough examination for her head injury.  
Carol then had the help of the excellent nurse practitioner Scott who cleaned and glued the wound on my daughter face just at her eye. It was an excellent job.  
Although my daughter was briefly distressed while having the treatment she was the back to her happy self, the staff made me her feel so comfortable and even made her laugh.  
I cant thank them both enough for for such a great service.

author: Witch12
title: My 4yr daughter
body: My daughter has many disabilities one being epilepsy. she can have up to 50+ seizures a day and can loose control of her bladder. More so at night, my daughter was in size 8 nappies which were just not big enough and were marking her as shes a very tall for her age also they were leaking, we could be changing her bed 2 times a night if not more. Our community peds referred her to the lovely incontinence nurse Catherine and within 2 weeks we had pads and pants, my daughter seems more comfortable with these and no more leaks.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: MissMay
title: Anxiety provoking care
body:
Today, I went to the midlands eye centre on the opinion of my optician. He said to tell them I had been referred there by him for my poorly eye. It’s worth mentioning that I am shielding from Covid since March - now (June). This is the first time I’ve left the house.  
I arrived and there was a queue outside - that’s fine most people are social distancing. Before I got inside I was told that by no means would my partner be allowed inside with me. My anxiety went from about a 5 to a 9. I got inside and I had to wait in the boxes on the box, completely sensible and made me feel safe. They had red tape on the floor asking you not to get close to the counter For the safety of the staff. Except, we both had masks on and I absolutely could not hear the receptionist at all so I have to go to the counter. It was virtually impossible to hear them but we managed it.  
I sat down and waited to be triaged by the nurse. I was called over to the counter. Now this was even more tricky than the reception desk because I can’t hear the triage nurse at all and they are asking me much more complex questions. The nurse asked if I had been referred to the centre I said yes by the optician. The nurse replied in a what I felt was a rude manner and asked where my letter was then.  
I explained I didn’t have one I just spoke to my optician on the phone. The nurse informed me if I didn't have a referral letter I could not be referred!  
Self referral it is then. I was a bit upset like I might be wasting people time but I had been told to come by the optician. I was then asked why I was here today. I said “well I spoke to the optician and he said....” the same nurse replied that they didn't CARE what the optician had said, they want to know why I was here today. I got quite upset at this point so I started to tell my story to this member of staff and again I felt they got cross and told me to just get to the point as why I am here now. At the end of the conversation they told me to go sit on the chairs. I had to ask for this to be repeated 3 times because I couldn’t hear. I was then shouted at at by this staff member.  
I was ready to walk out and leave at this point.  
Thankfully. The next nurse for my vision today was WONDERFUL. They were so kind and listened to me and made me feel important. After I saw them they took me round to see the doctor.  
I was in the waiting area to see the doctor and honestly I saw some questionable things... masks because worn not covering the nose by staff. Groups of staff in offices not social distancing. Cardigans being worn by nurses. Doctors walking around with gloves on touching doors and not changing their gloves. I clearly senior nurse belittled a health care assistant at once point, in a corridor, because they needed to use the bathroom. It was a bit of a sorry sight.  
I eventually got in to see the doctor and as I suspected I needed to have surgery. The then consultant came into the room to tell the doctor that they was not working quick enough and had a backlog of patients. Honestly I was really upset by this, the consultant did apologise for coming in but we were in the middle of the consultation and they interrupted us planning my care.  
By this point I burst into tears in the office. They haven’t performed the surgery I need in 4 months and they have no plans to reopen it. I am in so much pain and discomfort in my eye I said I can’t keep going on like this. The doctor was really kind, & I wasn't rushed out of the office despite the telling off they had just received from the boss. This doctor has given me some medicine to try and make my eye bearable for the time being.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Longell
title: Care by the a & e dept
body: I had a flair up of excruciating pain caused by inflammatory arthritis. Whilst it was too much of a fuss to get past the first huddle of getting through the entrance ( being ask unnecessary & irrelevant questions to gain admittance), once beyond that, the care from the drs & nurses & follow up by Dr Chikora of Rheumatology was outstanding. Very caring & extremely professional & productive treatment.

title: Been family used practice for 50 years
body:
Impossible to see a GP 

Though media says should have no problem

Not all illness can be treated over phone

title: Can’t fault doctors but the receptionists are…
body: They used to be so nice and now they’re just snappy, unhelpful and short. Don’t feel comfortable speaking to them at all!

author: Wizardshelly
title: Not happy at the care I received
body:
After giving birth at wishaw general the patient care was lacking to say to absolute least. I had been spoken to like a child from two support workers, I have had a traumatic birth which lead to an emergency section, up until that point health wise everything had been fine.  
During labour/emergency csection I developed a fever, which according to a min of 3 doctors is a normal occurrence they were treating me for sepsis and looking at my infection markers and given iv antibiotics straight away. However a midwife decided I should be tested for covid even though I had no other symptoms than a fever that was consistent with the drs finding of sepsis. A senior dr suggested I have a swab carried out- the middle of the night me and my baby who had just returned to me from the special care baby unit due to birthing complications were wheeled to what I later found out to be a hot covid ward with absolutely no proof.  
What makes it worse is that less than 24 hours later the test I had came back negative for covid 19 as I knew it would be as I had told them I had been shielding due to severe asthma and being 3rd trimester pregnant I was kept in the hot ward, with 1 support worker routinely appearing wearing a mask below her chin leaning over my baby. There is so much more I can add to this, I am not happy at all at the care I have received.

title: Really disappointing practice
body: Even before the coronovirus, it has been difficult to get help needed. As a patient who does not visit the doctor very often, even when I had a serious illness, I found that when I did make an appointment I came away from the doctors feeling that I had wasted his time. I was going through a particularly stressful period, but the doctor was not sympathetic at all. In fact, it has made me not wanting to visit the doctors again. The on line e consultation is useless, as I have was told twice to get in touch with 111 or emergency, which was not necessary. When I eventually got through to the surgery I was told that I had to change my answers, so in effect I had to lie, to get a call back from the doctor. I find it so stressful trying to get in touch with the surgery. Such a pity, as years ago it was so efficient and lovely.

title: Thank you to the staff of Ward 44
body: My brother, Alan, was with you for less than two weeks. He passed away peacefully, and I don't think he could have had better treatment anywhere. I live in Los Angeles and called often to check on him, and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. Thank you all so much for being with him in his final moments. Sincerely, Sheila Grimes.

author: Hj488
title: Pregnancy
body:
My last birth was 2.5 years ago at Grimsby hospital. I felt that they did not take into account my opinion or feelings and that the actions and remarks of my midwife gave me a negative experience, after working hard to have a very informed Hypnobirth.  
This pregnancy I decided to go to Pilgrim, and they have been so amazing. They take the time to listen and give women the options they deserve. They have a laugh and a joke to make you feel at ease and treat you with the upmost respect. They were quick to treat me and most importantly they explained everything that was happening and the reasons why.  
It has been a breath of fresh air.

author: Jesre49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Thank you
body: "I am happy that you answered my questions and helped me to understand what was going on. Very happy with the service over the phone from Jessica and the falls booklet that she sent out to me with exercises in, I have been doing them every day and will carry on. "

author: NoCure
title: My stay in Neurology
body:
I'd lost my ability to walk and was wheelchair bound. I'd lost my mobility and independence.  
The care and attention I received was excellent.All staff were friendly and helpful and checked regularly on all patients. I watched the nurses dealing with patients who had different difficulties from myself and their patience was fantastic. Their job is definitely a calling.I thank all who had something to do with my stay including those I never met (meals).

title: Having an ultrasound during lockdown
body:
1. Room was very small, 2 men and me 
2. No social distancing between me and the man. 
3. I was informed 5 days until result. It’s been one month, no result available yet and this is very important!

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Amazing kind staff
body: Yes although you make have difficulty trying to book an appointment, this surgery is the most kind! I've grown up going here so I'd recommend it.

title: Fantastic Service
body: Everycare have been so helpful during a time when my mother was taken into hospital with Covid and my father, who has dementia was left at home. They were so flexible with timings as things were changing on a weekly basis. This fantastic care has since continued after my mother was released from hospital and they are now both being cared for by all the lovely ladies from Everycare.

author: Shorty gran
title: The treatment I received
body:
I attended in June for a liver biopsy. The procedure under Dr English was second to non. Under the COVID situation. the whole experience was great. Not that anyone wants to be in a hospital at all but the treatment from porters to especially the nurses in ward 104 was excellent. I’m now waiting for a diagnosis, hoping this will help me with my health in the future, however I cannot be more than glad of the isolation procedures used to achieve my operation to be carried out.  
I would be happy if the people at the top of the N.H.S. let the staff below know how pleased they were with the work they carried out on a day to day basis. The nurses are so well trained I can understand why “Angels” is used as an expression regarding them. I also think that more money should be given to doctors and nurses for the dedication given to the public

title: Best service I ever had
body: New guidelines due to covid have lead to an amazingly improved service. Rang up at 1.30pm,telephoned back by the doctor at 3PM,asked to submit more info on line for her to look at....by 5PM had a text telling me my prescription was waiting at the pharmacy.  Brilliant service,no wait for appointments, no travel time.Efficient and definitely the way forward.Well done.

author: Ramone
title: My story is about how the Dirrans Center has helped me
body:
I have been attending the Dirrans centre for a couple of years now after my stroke in 2016 and I was a bit apprehensive at first but after a couple of visits meeting staff and service users I started to feel more comfortable and confident. They really made me feel welcomed and all the staff were very empathetic towards me and my situation and meeting other people that have had the same or similar experience has been so helpful in my recovery.  
My life was a complete mess I really didn’t want to carry on. I was in a very dark place and the Dirrans staff gave me a glimmer of light at the end of my long and dark tunnel they dug me out of the hole that I was in and gave me a real reason to live again and try to rebuild my life back up again.  
I knew I would never have my old life back again I had already accepted that but the staff at the Dirrans centre particularly Darren and William brought me back to a place where I could create a new life for myself it was a long road but baby step after baby step I got there now I have my own home and I’m pretty independent and I owe a lot of that to the Dirrans centre the services they provide are truly a valuable necessity to the community.

readBy.name: North Ayrshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: supportive and careful
body: I just want to say a massive thank you to everyone who made my surgery/day care a pleasant experience. I was admitted to hospital and done an operation. Due to pandemic of COVID. 19 no-one was looking after me and honestly I was so impress with the level of care I had receive from young lady at the surgery. She came out for home visit and I felt safe and at ease. Thank you !! Keep up the fantastic work! Your work doesn’t go unnoticed! THANKS!

title: Excellent
body: Professional, kind, courteous, informative receptionists. You feel welcome. Very impressed by the care and professionality of my Doctor. Proper clinical examination, compassion and good listening. You never feel rushed. Thank you!

title: Great practice
body: From entering PIU to angiogram/plasty to CCU the treatment and care could not have been better. All the staff were wonderful. Caring and cheerful. Not at anytime during my treatment did I not feel confident that the doctor and nurses were giving 100% and I would like to say a big thank you to all :-)

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

author: Lar 34
title: Midwife
body:
I Can’t thank the Midwife’s who looked after my throughout my pregnancy and labour. At the height of the pandemic, my midwife (Kirstie) made me feel at ease and spoke through the regular changes within the labour ward because of this. She made me feel at ease and always ensured if I was worried about something I shouldn’t hesitate to call triage or herself for advice.  
During labour the two Midwife’s (Emma and Alex) made me feel at ease throughout and apart from the masks worn you would never have known the current situation. I felt looked after and cared for throughout

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: Caring, welcoming "home from home"
body: After a fall in 2019, Margaret, a family friend, spent the last year of her life as a resident in Gordon Lodge. It's an excellent rest home, the team are very caring, it's clean, the food is very good and it's well managed, especially during the Covid-19 pandemic. Under normal circumstances, a hairdresser visits as does a podiatrist, our friend was able to receive Holy Communion each month, there is regular entertainment and activities, and visitors are made exceptionally welcome. I can highly recommend this home without reservations.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: greypassions
title: Traumatic experiences
body:
I have been a patient in the eye clinic since mid-2019 and most of my experiences in the clinic have been absolutely terrible, to the point where each new appointment or visit fills me with severe anxiety.  
I have a complex and painful corneal condition, and the few treatments I have been given only seem to make the problem worse. When I try to assert some control over my treatment pathway I am met with resistance. Little attention is given to the daily pain I am left to endure, it seems as if this is not considered worth addressing. An example of this is the refusal to provide any pain relief even after eye surgery, for which recovery is unimaginably painful.  
Medical staff have been repeatedly dismissive and unable to show empathy to me when I am in severe pain and distress. Waiting times between appointments are ludicrous, to the point where I have had many more emergency appointments with whoever is available than my actual treatment team. The only positive aspect of this clinic is the nursing staff, who are very caring and attentive, but they have limited ability to help.

title: Fabulous practice
body: The doctors and nurses and the reception staff are extremely helpful. Reception staff always friendly and doctors care is amazing and thorough.

title: Fantastic
body: This practice has always been excellent but especially in May when I was referred urgently even though it was during the pandemic. The use of the accurx telemedicine was fantastic.

title: An Amazing service
body: My mammogram was due on the first day of COVID lockdown, therefore cancelled. I thought that it would have been delayed for months, on the contrary, it was rescheduled as soon as it was possible. When I arrived at the clinic it was beautifully organised for the COVID measures. The staff extremely kind, understanding and sympathetic. They thoroughly explained the procedure and I received the response in less than a week. Thank You for your wonderful service!!

author: Sara2480
title: The Kidney Community  Occupational Therapy Team
body:
I have had continuous support from this team due to my kidney disease, the team is very small only with one occupational therapist and another staff member who helps out however very helpful.  
I would not be able to cope without this team, they have literally helped me soo much. I believe they are underfunded and need more staff as it seems like it is difficult for 1 main person to do this job with all the kidney patients they must help. I had never heard about occupational therapy before so I had no idea what they do and how they do it and often I found my self asking silly questions because of my ignorance about their job- which was embarrassing but I wasn't made to feel like a nuisance.  
I would definitely recommend this team and hope the government gives them better funding as they are absolutely amazing and changed my life for the better, I am forever grateful.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: Gestalt
title: My care for Alcohol addiction.
body:
I have been useing the services at One Recovery High Wycombe since December 2019. My journey to sobriety has been life changing and the sevices and support offered have been second to none, especially my key worker and Detox Nurse Jade Groves who has been so supportive and her knowledge of addiction has been a game changer.
I am now over 3months sober and I have got my self respect and life back in order life is so much better without alcohol, relationships with my family and freinds are all good.
So if you are reading this and think you might have a problem give these people a go they don't judge you but help you see the way forward good luck.

author: Mike K
title: End-of-life care, concerning my brother
body: One year ago today my brother Lance, who had suffered a subarachnoid brain bleed in March 2019, had a sudden collapse at his (excellent) care home, Ashton Lodge, and was brought to Northwick Park Hospital, where despite great efforts on your part he passed away. I arrived in London from Manchester that evening, with my wife, and by 10 pm had been conducted by your specialist staff, with the most extraordinary tact, compassion and efficiency, through the steps which had to be taken, including what was for me the most painful part, the viewing of his body. Thank you, all of you.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Execellent through and through.
body: I broke the radius in my arm in Febrary and cut my head. I was seen within 15 minutes of arriving in A&E, I had an X-ray and my head wound stitched.Then my arm was put in a half plaster cast. Within five hours I was back home. Two days later I had an operation to repair my broken bone in the SSU department. The surgeon was excellent as was everyone I came into contact with. Personally I can only praise the attention and care I received and cannot fault anything.

author: Larst55
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Therapy Team input
body: Andrea who visited was very good, the equipment provided has been very helpful and has helped my relative with 'day to day' living, Andrea rang me twice and checked everything was okay and the red cross delivery driver was also extremely helpful.

author: Helch33
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Requiring a piece of equipment to support with transfers
body: My wife needed a piece of equipment to help with safer transfers and the Therapy Team were efficient in arranging this for me which has made the task much easier.   I am very happy with the service provided.

author: Helch33
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Difficulty with transfers in and out of bed
body: My mother was having difficulty with bed transfers and positioning in bed so the OT came out and gave me advice and recommendations to make this easier for us

author: Larst55
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Physiotherapy home visits
body:
Vicky visited and looked around the house to see what equipment would help my husband, different items were tried and some didn't work but other things did and Vicky really tried everything to help.  
Everybody who visited us were nice, polite and cheerful and the equipment provided has really helped.  
The Physiotherapy home service has been very, very good

author: Larst55
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Very pleased with the Therapy Team
body: Very pleased, really helpful and equipment is brilliant. Happy with everything, cannot find any fault with this service.

author: Lilyok22
title: Very helpful
body:
Hello,  
First of all I have to thanks you for the service, I really appreciate it. I had a very good experience for the last 2 years, especially when I started the sessions with Mike. Mike is very professional and he understood exactly what l need, he helped me alot. I feel alot better.  
Finally I would like to thank you all.

author: mythic
title: The best dentist I've been to
body: Hi just want to thank the amazing staff at Glasgow Dental Hospital and the amazing dentist Gabrielle who treated me today. The staff where friendly chatty and made me feel comfortable. The staff where very professional and the standard of cleanliness and protection due to Covid 19 was fantastic. Its a extremely difficult time for us all but the staff at the dental hospital have been working hard from the start and I want everyone to know how grateful I am for the hard work they have been doing. The dentist Gabrielle was so kind, caring and the best dentist I've been to. Very pleasant and extremely professional had the best root treatment ever. Quick and pain-free whilst feeling at ease. Amazing dentist and amazing team of nurse's. Thank you so much. Thank you for treatment during this time. Stay safe.

author: sunshinebutterfly
title: The care and compassion was amazing
body:
I just wanted to praise the staff at QEUH maternity outpatient department. Having come back from my 20 week scan I cannot express fully how lovely, kind and caring everyone was.  
During Covid-19 pandemic when things are different, challenging and unexpected at points, this service seems to take everything in its stride and doing it with a smile from the staff you see in the corridors through to the cheery reception staff! A particular highlight was my sonographer - Leanne (apologies if I've spelt your name wrong!). I had the good luck to have her scan me at 13 weeks and 20 weeks. The care and compassion shown by Leanne was amazing. From a cheery manner on showing me to the room, the detailed and clear explanations of what she was scanning for and what she found through to answer any questions I had. All while having a conversation and a few laughs along the way.  
During this somewhat draughting time being unable to have my husband with me at scan appointments Leanne had me totally at ease and smiling.  
Thank you

title: Fantastic service, care.
body: Had eye problem, was seen promptly , nurse done checks than was told to wait, few minutes later was called by Doctor.  Was very caring and felt Doctor was very sincere.  Absolutely first class service.  Proud to live in a country with premiere heath care. Well done NHS.  Many Thanks to all at Heartlands A & E.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very patient and caring
body: Reception, Nurses and Doctors are always very patient and helpful when calling or having an appointment. Caring and kind when talking to you.

title: Telephone Contact
body: Lovely Surgery and Staff but phone contact is horrendous at the moment.  My husband phoned over 50 times at Bolts Hill, Chartham and still permanently engaged.  The Surgery at Chilham never answers the phone.

title: A good experience
body:
I was shaken and cross with myself as the red hot boiling coffee grounds coated my fingers from the full open filter which, a moment ago, was precariously perching on the mug. 
I ran the hand under the cold water for half an hour and noticed that the burn was the size of a 50 pence piece and from my first aid training in the distant past, I remember it meant I should consult my doctor.

I didn’t want to impose on the drs obviously as it might not be serious enough and also, the prospect of having to go into a doctor’s waiting room was daunting during this pandemic lockdown.

Luckily, nowadays the patients get triaged via AskmyGP, I sent In a photo to help. 
I was referred by my Dr and practice nurse for next day treatment at Southmead Burns unit, very accommodating, really impressive, thank you very much.

The hospital treatment was professional and thorough, I saw a hard working and friendly nurse and doctor there, they gave me lots of useful information on my condition, it was educational and reassuring as I’d know what I should be vigilant about and what to do in all scenarios.
They also gave me literature to reiterate and contact numbers if need be. There was a letter and dressing for the practice nurse who would dress my wounds and check on the healing progress.

Both GP and hospital have all pandemic safety measures in place, the environment was orderly, prepared, safe and shielded.

Good experience!

author: Scruffles
title: Discrimination
body: I was with the mental health services in Enfield for many years in the past but did not find them very helpful at all. As far as I am concerned I was with them because of suffering with quite serious mental health problems for many years in my life. My description of these problems would be depression, anxiety and PTSD. However a long time ago when I was 13 years old I was also diagnosed with Asperger’s syndrome too, which is something that I have always had doubts about as it never seemed to sit right with me (or at least not in the way that people seemed to assume that I was affected by it). So when I was under these services they kept treating me as though this label was true and trying to push treatment on me for it which I could not accept or go along with as I felt that this would have been the wrong support for me as I was trying to get help for the mental health issues that I was experiencing. However they never seemed to really listen to me about this (even though they would pretend to) as they would just carry on acting in the same way and treating me in a way which if anything had more of a harmful effect on my mental wellbeing, and then in the end they just seemed to write me of as being a difficult personality and dropped me altogether because I would not agree with them, even though all I ever really wanted was to get the right sort of support to help me to recover more and always did my best to act well. I think that when you have a label such as this though and people are aware of it then they make judgements about you based upon that, and then also start assuming things about you that are not really real. So if you are suffering from anxiety and things whilst you are around them then they end up making judgments about you based only on the surface appearance of things, and then assume that you are really like that because you have some sort of learning disability or are mentally handicapped in some way where you do not understand things, and then they feel that they have to start acting in a strange way around you without really getting to know you properly first or understanding the true reasons why you are like that. It is as though they like to put everything into nice easy boxes for themselves and assume that they know better about things because they have some sort of title or qualification. Plus they would also listen to my parents a lot who called them up and sometimes even pass on information about me to them, even though I had tried explaining to them that my relationship with them had been bad for my mental wellbeing over the years due to the problems that they also have. In fact I am not even saying that I am not affected by this condition in some way or that I am not on that spectrum at all (as many people probably are). But all I know is that even if this label of aspergers syndrome was true in some way then it would still not be true in the same way that people have seemed to assume that I am affected by it and the assumptions that they have made based around that. Since I do think that there is quite a lot of stigma and discrimination out there to do with a person’s mental state or the way that their brain is working, and in my experiences the mental health services in Enfield are certainly no exception to this either even though they might like to hide behind a phoney image and pretend to be something different. So much so that it has even left me feeling quite bad for people who actually are affected by this condition or affected by it more acutely, because I know from my own treatment the amount of judgment and discrimination that they must have to endure. I was discharged from the mental health services a long time ago and since then I have developed a physical problem with my body due to the mental illness eventually taking its toll on me, which I have found to be difficult to live with. I have been trying to work through my mental health issues for a long time by myself after I realised that I was not going to get any help from the services and gave up on them, but my physical problem has also made them a lot worse (and perhaps may not have even developed it in the first place if the service had been better). So I reluctantly tried to get a referred back to the mental health services because I was struggling so much with things but every time they just ignored me and never got back in touch. Until I ended up calling the NHS helpline again on the last occasion that I tried and I was referred to the Crisis Team who arranged a meeting with me. I met a man and a woman at the meeting and I think that one of them was supposed to be a psychologist or something (although I wasn’t convinced) and I sat there for quite a long time explaining things to them and talking about previous experiences as well as things that I had been through in my life that I felt had caused me to have these types of problems, and they also asked me quite a few personal questions too including to do with incidents of sexual assault that I had happened to me whilst they wrote loads of stuff down on paper. But then after all of this they just seemed to completely ignore everything that I had said to them and one of them told me that they saw aspergers in my, despite the fact that they had only just met me and that they were also not qualified in that area as far as I am aware to make such a diagnosis. So it then became apparent to me that this was probably the idea that they had in mind before the meeting had even taken place and also the outcome that they had already planned and wanted to happen, and that the whole thing had really just been a bit of an act as they still had the same ideas about me that other people had from all those years ago. Even though it is apparently not even that uncommon for the effects of trauma to sometimes be mistaken as part of the autistic spectrum anyway, and I also had a scarf over my mouth because of the pandemic so they couldn’t even see my expressions properly. They did not give me the referral that I wanted but instead wanted me to go to another organisation that specialises with autism so that I can get reassessed, even though I explained to them that I was not in a position to do this right now because of the problems in my life as it could mean that I loose benefit money that I need to survive which would make my mental health even worse. They even told me that I would not get paid any money for having mental illness although I am not sure if they were speaking the truth or not as everything just seemed to be based around the assumption that I definitely did have this condition and that this would have been confirmed by having such a test. So I told them that they would do exactly the same thing as me if they were in the same position instead of putting themselves in danger which they disagreed with, even though they could not come up with any alternative solutions. Then after this meeting they closed the door on me and pretty much left me to die again, even after I had told them that I was getting closer to the edge and I ended up leaving that meeting feeling even worse than I did before. Plus I’m not even that sure why having a condition such as aspergers should affect you from getting help for your mental illnesses from that service, or why they would think that they know someone better than they know themselves. At this point though I am not even sure if I care that much anymore as I have lost my faith and trust in this service and I can understand why I have heard to many people complain about the Crisis Team and why there are so many bad reviews online about the Enfield Mental Health Service which still doesn’t seem to have changed much. They certainly don’t make it very easy for me to accept myself even if you do have a condition such as aspergers syndrome due to the amount of stigma that they have towards people and the assumptions that they make. In fact the last social worker that I had with them years ago would even talk with me about a lot of conspiracy theories or aliens and things because they seemed to have an idea that this was the sort of thing that I was into. Even though I think that it is quite obvious that this is not really a very good idea when you are working with vulnerable and mentally ill people who could be suffering from paranoia, and this is probably just one example of the absurd sort of stuff that goes on there.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Barnet, Enfield and Haringey Mental Health NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Kindness and Care
body: Wanted to find a way to thank the practice for your support this morning from my initial phone call to the receptionist, to my speedy call back from a doctor within 15 minutes, and a super efficient pharmacy team to complete the support needed. In these difficult times at every stage you all listened to my concern, reacted quickly to ensure I was provided with the care needed. I was back home within an hour with a plan for onward care and an immediate response which was so reassuring.

title: Really caring
body:
My dad who was 72 has a major operation. Was taken to ICU.
I couldnt have been any more grateful the nurses was so good and took such high care of my dad. When I saw my dad the 1st time I was in tears but the nurse had gave me great comfort saying they would do everything they could to make sure my dad would be okay and they did.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Where are the receptionists?
body: Tried to phone on two separate occasions today but no answer even though it was ringing for some time. Unfortunately, this is not the first time this has happened.

author: Emmrd63
title: Advocacy Support during lockdown
body:
These have been very challenging times but I am grateful that you can continue to practice in a way that protects the most vulnerable patients whilst adhering to legal responsibilities.  
My experience of the team is that they have been exceptional in these times and in my opinion have worked over and above what is expected in their usual roles

title: Super triage nurse
body: Had bloods today. Best ever. Didn’t feel a thing and the nurse was fantastic. Strange being treated in a tent but needs must. Nobody wants to go to the doctors, but if you have to, come to Litcham. Happy patient.

title: Brilliant!!
body: We’re so lucky to have this MIU. The staff are fabulous without exception, kind, knowledgeable and experienced. I couldn’t fault the care we got today. Well done

author: Matms93
title: Thank you Kath and DRC Team
body:
Dear Kath and DRC Team,  
we would like to thank you on behalf of the Ruby "A" Ward for the delivery service you offered today. It was very thoughtful and you all made our day. We miss our function and workshop sessions but under these extreme circumstances it is understandable.  
Thank you it was really appreciated. Stay safe.  
Signed. xxxxx

title: Radiology visit for CT scan
body:
Just looking to thank the staff members who looked after me to carry out a chest scan, in such difficult times as we are at present, they were cheerful, kind, totally competent and a real pleasure.
We are extremely lucky to have the hospital and staff in our community, long may it continue.

title: tremendous response
body: Occupational Therapy have swung into action to support my 99 year old Mother in Law after she fell down the stairs dislocating her shoulder.  Many aids have been recommended and supplied by well trained and personable staff.  From the assessment to the delivery and installation everything has been very professional.

title: Fantastic understanding of my mothers problem
body: I can highly recommend this surgery fantastic communication and understanding of the situation which I was in mother is going  in to dementia and also I am locked down with a shield letter things were getting very tense at home informed my mothers GP of the situation mother was getting very aggressive Agitated and wanted to do harm to myself informed the clinical nurse of the situation through an appointment obviously can’t come out the The Covid situation but by listening to my problems between the clinical nurse and the GPs at the clinic they got back in touch me within a matter of an hour with a solution to help my predicament and my mothers medication was provided and now my mother is stable she has calmed down And also she functions better while she’s on the medication i.e. she can do things for her self now as before she even forgot to make a cup of tea so thank you very much Berwick Surgery for all your fantastic help and understanding and compassion in the situation you are a credit to your profession and I would recommend this surgery to anybody your sincerely Ronnie

title: Appauling in every way
body: Hi I work in a residential home for disabled adults, I attended you minor injuries unit with my client who was later diagnosed with a broken leg, when you informed us she required a supportive boot rather than plaster, you tried 1 size before attempting to dismiss us, only when the staff member insisted she required a boot did you manage to find a larger size. Then around a week later I returned to swap the boot as it had become contaminated, when I explained this to your receptionist they assured me the new boot would be waiting for me at the door, when I arrived at the agreed time, it was not ready, and your staff made several attempts to bring me inside, I explained several time there was no need for me to come in, eventually someone came out and spoke to me around 2 inches away from my face, when I stepped back to try and ensure 2 meter she followed me around the car park, around 1 hour later, I was given the boot in the wrong size and had to inform you of this so it can be swapped, then when I phoned 6 weeks later to enquire around a follow up you were very unhelpful then as well, I understand you are under stress with C19 however we all are and still managing to execute our roles effectively

title: Great  practice
body: I want to say thank you for all the help since I've moved to westbromich I need tablets I get them straight away appointment I get straight away just wanted to say thank you

title: Fantastic service over COVID-19 period
body: I have had a number of phone consultations during the COVID-19 period for ongoing conditions.  I have been extremely happy with the care and advice given to me each time - Drs have been kind, courteous, and ready and willing to listen to my concerns each and every time.  This is made all the more exceptional due to the pressures the NHS is under at the moment.  In fact, the phone service is so excellent, I would like it to continue when normal service returns if possible.  I am able to speak to the Dr that I need to, and on my day of choice, so continuity of care and ease of use has been even better than normal.  Well done all for such a fantastic service.

title: Huge improvement
body:
Prior to covid it was sometimes quite challenging to access services at this GP. However since coronavirus the Glenlyn team have made huge improvements in service provision. 

Within the last few weeks I have needed to access GP services for non urgent needs and have been able to organise this easily with the new booking options they have in place. I have found the online booking system and video GP appointments really effective. The service is responsive and works in an efficient manner.

I’m an A&E nurse myself and am impressed by how this GP practice has adapted to the changing situation in the current climate.

I would highly recommend.

title: Unhelpful incompetent reception staff
body: On Monday this week I called GP and asked receptionist if they can help me with my issue, she was very nice and she said she ask manager and will call me back. Later she called me and she said they can do it and, she asked me to to come to the office next day with documents and tell the staff, that manager is aware about my problem and will meet me, unfortunately the person I was spiking with was off this day. When I went there next day I've met like a stone wall. I had to explain my issues once again, I've been told that it is impossible to talk to manager, and in the end I've been told to go to hospital if I'm dying. I wasn't dying, I still feel healthy, but is possible I can be in severe condition if nobody help me. Later I tried to contact manager by phone but again I've been sent to hospital by personnel. I'm still healthy, I think hospital is for sick people, I'm paying taxes and insurance, I feel deeply offended by the staff

title: Oaktree
body: I cannot recommend the Oaktree clinic enough..I was suffering really bad with gad and was struggling quite a bit...not only were they fast when it came to seeing me but they’re services have been amazing in helping me have the turn around I did....the staff in ALL sectors have been wonderful and are worth they’re weight in gold in some ways I feel this helped not only save my life but also changed it too

title: Physiotherapy is excellent! Good trust.
body:
I visited Royal United Hospital in Bath on the 29th January 2020, for my first physiotherapy appointment in the Children's Outpatients Department, due to referral from Keynsham Medical Practice but before that, Bristol Children's Hospital. The reason why I needed physiotherapy was due to the fact that my pelvic x-ray showed at least a issue, my hips were getting tight, plus I noticed a weird feature. It was my knees of course, because my right knee was noticed to be taller than my left knee, plus just before that, I was given a referral by my GP at Harptree, because given the fact was that I had tenderness in my joints and I wasn't even wearing my insoles. I had episodes of pain at my school in Weston-Super-Mare, the Uphill area, so this prompted me to be seen by my GP. Now, on the day of my first physiotherapy appointment, I was seen by a nice and kind physiotherapist. Given the fact that I'm permanently deaf, my type is sensory and profound deafness, I never found it hard and started having exercises and got my list of exercises and have not yet gotten any more exercise during lockdown, plus it was a great way to just stop having those pains, as I now have them rarely. So, I will keep having physiotherapy to stop those tenderness but my knees sometimes wobble or hurt.

Well done to RUH Bath!

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

author: yellowbq98
title: The service didn't do my PTSD any favours
body:
I have had Post Traumatic Stress Disorder for the last 22 years, it was only diagnosed 3 years ago by me and then this diagnosis was confirmed by a specialist. Two years ago I got diagnosed with Leukemia due to the continuing effect that PTSD had on my immune system over so many years. The GP surgery missed both PTSD and Cancer diagnosis.  
I was taken to Croydon University Hospital where I was diagnosed fairly quickly, but the service I got for the 6 months was not very good. Yes I survived and I am thankfully in remission, but that was because of my determination more than anything. The chemo helped cure the cancer but the bad service didn't do my PTSD. Any favours.  
I was advised by my GP to use Royal Marsden which I did but I was told by my oncologist at CUH that this was not ideal so I chose to stay at CUH. From problems in the administration down to the actual care I have stuck with them and nothing about the service has improved at all. I am now needing to find somewhere else to go as dealing with so many issues creates problems with my PTSD and really I am not asking for anything other than decent care and that is not happening.

author: robinwe69
title: Good experience with Lanarkshire Dietitians
body: Yesterday I experienced an online video consultation with one of Lanarkshire’s Dietitian’s. This was the next step after I was diagnosed with Coeliac Disease. The dietitian showed a powerpoint full of necessary information and provided me with excellent sources, which will make life easier, living with the disease. I thought this service was fantastic from the NHS! !

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: COVID friendly
body:
Please could I just pass on my thoughts  and gratitude to you the practice doctors and Staff ,
I visited the surgery for the first time this morning since the pandemic arose , and I would just like to say how safe I felt , and the effort the staff and practice have made to make the surgery as safe as can be , I’ve not been out and about much during this pandemic and was quite anxious about visiting the surgery, but I can say I needn’t off .
Thank you all once again
Keep up the good work
Stay safe

title: Poor management of covid .
body:
However while waiting for my appointment in out patients I observed shocking practices. The hospital had gone to great lenghth to protect patents from corona virus. However I experienced no help with direction. I saw 9 members of admin staff ignoring social distance 2 qualified staff bringing their lunch back ignoring social distancing. 2 security staff just pushing their way through the crowds.
Crowding was allowed in the main area of the hospital . I myself needed to go to the volunteers reception to ask where hand washing and masks where kept.
Absolutely shocking . 
Please please the regulators need to visit with some urgency if even to save one member of the publics life. 
Who is managing this its a hospital .

title: Poor service
body: I arrived at minor injuries in a panic with my 15yr old daughter who had cut her arm with a razor blade. I knew they closed at 10pm and it was 9.52pm. The reception was unmanned, with no way to notify anyone that we had arrived. At 9.53pm a receptionist (I assume) appeared and immediately announced that we would not be treated and didn't even ask what the injury was. I explained that my daughter had cut her wrist with a razor and due to many recent visits to minor injuries, I believed it required glueing and steristrips applied. (A 5min job at most which has unfortunately been done before) they still did not even take a look and told me to either ring 111 or go to Treliske and told 'well it is five to ten, which it wasn't.  I left immediately to travel to Truro, with my daughter's bleeding wrist; it was still 9.54pm when I got in my car!! Where is the duty of care? Really terrible attitude and manner
